animal_concentrations.References: (1) Macneil JD et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 46: 300-304 (1991) (2) Clark DR JR et al; Ecotoxicol 4: 258-65 (1995)(3) Clark DR JR et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 2: 387-393 (1983) (4) Elliot JE et al; Environ Monit Assess 12: 67-82 (1989) (5) Elliot JE et al; pp. 181-94 in Persistant Pollut Mar Ecosys. Walker,CH & Livingstone,DR eds. Oxford,UK: Pergamon (1992) (6) Ellis DH et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 42: 57-64 (1989) (7) Custer TW et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 30: 163-169 (1996) (8) Dearth MA, Hites RA; Environ Sci Technol 25: 1279-1285 (1991) (9) Jarman WM et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 57: 8-15 (1996)
animal_concentrations.Value: Oxychlordane was detected at a concentration of 4 ppb in a wild Canadian Bison(1). Bats obtained from caves in Mexico contained oxychlordane at concentration of 0.0-0.3 ppm(2). Bats obtained from caves in Missouri contained oxychlordane at concentrations of 0.4-4.6 ug/g(3). Eggs from Canadian seabirds and gulls contained oxychlordane at concentrations of 0.02-0.20 mg/kg(4,5). Oxychlordane was detected in falcon eggs in Colorado and New Mexico at concentrations of 0.49 ppm in 1979 and 0.09 ppm in 1982(6). Mallard ducks released near a sewage treatment plant in Bloomington IN, had undetectable levels of oxychlordane at the time of their release but average concentrations of 0.11 ug/g and 0.18 ug/g were detected after 52 and 100 days of exposure respectively(7). Ambient levels of oxychlordane were measured in seals (170 ng/g), polar bears (1600 ng/g), porpoises (250 ng/g), penguins (16 ng/g), squid (1.2 ng/g), gulls (29 ng/g) and various species of fish (0.1-160 ng/g)(8). Oxychlordane was detected in Falcon eggs in California at concentrations of 13-86 mg/kg(9).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) Giesy JP et al; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 27: 202-12 (1994) (2) Dogheim SM et al; J Assoc Anal Chem 71: 882-74 (1988) (3) Rantio T; Chemosphere 32: 253-65 (1996) (4) Devault DS; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 15: 349-56 (1986) (5) Giesy JP; Toxic Contam In Large Lakes, Schmidke NE Ed. Chelsea, MI: Lewis Publishers Inc (1988) Salata GG et al; Environ Pollut 88: 167-75 (1995) (7) Kuehl DW et al; Chemosphere 29: 523-35 (1994)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Various species of freshwater fish in Michigan rivers had detectable levels (0.15-15.99 ug/kg) of oxychlordane(1). Fish from Egyptian lakes contained oxychlordane at concentration of 0.02-0.05 ppm(2). Oxychlordane was detected in fish sampled near 2 pulp mills in Finland(3). Oxychlordane was detected in fish obtained from Wisconsin rivers and lakes at concentrations of 0.04-0.47 mg/kg(4). Eggs from Chinook salmon in Lake Michigan contained oxychlordane at concentrations of 35.6-301.2 ug/kg(5). Oxychlordane was detected in dolphins in the Gulf of Mexico at an average concentration of 393 ng/g(6). Oxychlordane was detected in bottom feeding fish at 108 out of 400 fresh water lakes and rivers in the US at an average concentration of 48 ng/g(7).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Sarkka J et al; Chemosphere 26: 2147-60 (1993) (2) Tate CM, Heiny JS; Arch Environ Contam Toxicol 30:62-78 (1996) (3) Bishop CA et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 14: 491-501 (1995)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: Oxychlordane was detected at a concentration of 1 ng/g in the top layer (1 cm) of sediment in a lake in Finland located near a pulp mill(1). Sediment from the South Platte River basin contained oxychlordane at concentrations less than 1 ug/kg(2). Sediment from the St. Lawerence River contained oxychlordane at concentrations of 0.0-1.9 ug/g(3).
